page.title: 09Landscape & Build.-Ide Hill
page.content: {Wickhurst Manor} The core of this manor house is a medieval stone hall with an open roof displaying the octagonal crown post and truss intact. On one side of the oak-panelled entrance hall is the parlour with 16th.C linenfold panelling and on the side the dining-room also with oak panelling which has possibly been imported from elsewhere. From outside the old hall part is of coursed rubble masonry with a tiled roof. The south facing wall of the hall has freestone dressings to the windows which were lowered in the 19th.C restoration to provide open views to the south for the occupants.
